meanings.definition: Lack of intelligence or thought; emptiness
meanings.sent1: The vacuousness of his stare made it clear he wasn't paying attention.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with a sense of vacuousness after the party ended.
meanings.sent3: Her essay was so full of vacuousness that it seemed like she hadn't even tried.
meanings.sent4: The vacuousness of the abandoned house gave it an eerie feeling.
meanings.sent5: The vacuousness of the black hole was both fascinating and terrifying.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of intelligence or thought; empty-headed
meanings.sent1: She gave a vacuousness smile when she didn't understand the joke.
meanings.sent2: The movie portrayed the villain as a vacuousness character with no depth.
meanings.sent3: His vacuousness behavior at the meeting made everyone question his competence.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech was full of vacuousness promises that no one believed.
meanings.sent5: The student's vacuousness expression during the exam revealed his lack of preparation.
